CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function does not properly sanitize the user input that is passed to the 'Unicode' function. An attacker can inject malicious scripts through the user input, which will then be executed in the user's browser. This can lead to various attacks such as stealing sensitive information, session hijacking, defacement of the website, etc.
